noteParagraph.text: Processes involving only a single technical art, e.g. drying, coating, for which provision exists elsewhere are classified in the relevant class for that art.

titlePart.text: SELECTION OF MATERIALS FOR THEIR MAGNETIC PROPERTIES

noteParagraph.text: Inductances and transformers are regarded in this sub-class as being "for power supply" if they are intended for this purpose even in systems operating at frequencies above 60 cycles/sec.

titlePart.text: Magnets or magnetic bodies characterised by the magnetic materials therefor
Selection of materials for their magnetic properties
in the form of particles, e.g. powder
Mixtures of metallic and non-metallic particles
in the form of particles, e.g. powder
dispersed or suspended in a liquid or plastic medium
the particles being of different materials
Mixtures of metallic and non-metallic particles

titlePart.entryReference: powder coatings on sheets , on strips or ribbons , on wires

titlePart.text: wound on non-magnetic supports, e.g. formers
Arrangements of electric connections to coils, e.g. leads

titlePart.entryReference: for purifying liquids, for separating ores

titlePart.text: Means for releasing the attractive force
Circuit arrangements for obtaining desired operating characteristics, e.g. for slow operation, for sequential energisation of windings, for high-speed energisation of windings
Thin magnetic films, e.g. of one-domain structure
characterised by the coupling or physical contact with connecting or interacting conductors

titlePart.entryReference: applying thin magnetic films to substrates

titlePart.text: characterised by the substrate or intermediate layers
characterised by the composition of the substrate
characterised by the composition of intermediate layers
Apparatus or processes for magnetising or demagnetising
Details of inductances or transformers covered by groups
Arrangements for interchanging inductances, transformers, or coils thereof
with special arrangement or spacing of turns of the winding(s), e.g. to produce desired self-resonance
Circuits for modifying, or compensating for, electric characteristics of inductances or transformers
with core substantially closed in itself, e.g. toroid
Audio-frequency transformers or mutual inductances, i.e. not suitable for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range
Transformers or mutual inductances suitable for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range
Broad-band transformers, e.g. suitable for handling frequencies well down into the audio range
Transformers having magnetic bias, e.g. for handling pulses
Variable inductances or transformers, e.g. constructions for changing voltage ratio or frequency range
by relative movement of turns or parts of winding(s)
by movement of core or part of core relative to the winding(s) as a whole
by varying the permeability of the core, e.g. by varying magnetic bias
by means of a movable shield
Connectors with inductive coupling, i.e. with movable core, coil, or winding for making connections without contact
Constructional details of transformers or inductances in general
Leading of conductors or axles through casings, e.g. for tap-changing arrangements
Mounting, supporting, or suspending transformers, reactors, or choke coils
Arrangements for purifying, drying, or filling
Cooling by special gases or non-ambient air
Cooling by heat conduction through solid or powdered fillings
Fastening parts of the core together
Fastening or mounting the core on casing or support
Fastening or clamping coils, windings, or parts thereof together
Fastening or mounting coils or windings on core, casing, or other support
Insulating of coils, windings, or parts thereof
Special means for preventing or reducing unwanted electric or magnetic effects, e.g. no-load losses, reactive currents, harmonics, oscillations, leakage fields
Electric or magnetic shields or screens
Structural association with built-in electric component, e.g. fuse
Circuits for modifying, or compensating for, electric characteristics of transformers, reactors, or choke coils
Variable transformers, reactors, or choke coils, for power supply or unspecified use
with tappings on coil or winding
with provision for rearrangement or interconnection of windings
having provision for tap-changing without interrupting the load current
with current collector gliding or rolling on or along winding
with core, coil, winding, or shield movable to offset variation of voltage or phase shift, e.g. induction regulators
having movable part of magnetic circuit
having movable coil, winding, or part thereof
Single-phase transformers for power supply or unspecified use
having two or more secondary windings, each supplying a separate load, e.g. for power-supply units for radio sets
High-leakage transformers, e.g. for arc welding
Cascade transformers, e.g. for use with extra high tension
Two-phase, three-phase, or polyphase transformers for power supply or unspecified use
for changing the number of phases
Transformers for operation with non-linear input/output characteristics for power supply or unspecified use, e.g. for generating harmonics, for changing wave shape
Transformers with superconductive windings or with windings operating at cryogenic temperatures
titlePart.entryReference: electromagnets without armatures and having a superconductive winding

titlePart.text: Reactors or choke coils for power supply or unspecified use
Transformers, inductances, reactors, or choke coils without magnetic cores, for power supply or unspecified use
Circuit arrangements for modifying, or compensating for, electric characteristics
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing or assembling the devices covered by this sub-class
for manufacturing cores, coils, or magnets
Winding conductors on to or threading conductors through cores or formers which are closed in themselves, e.g. toroids
for applying thin magnetic films to substrates
titlePart.entryReference: covering metals, or materials with metals, in general

titlePart.text: the material being applied in the form of particles
